Name: Ville de Québec
Builder: Morton Engineering and Dry Dock Co., Quebec City
awards: Atlantic 1942–1944, Mediterranean 1943, English Channel 1944–1945;[1] Gulf of St. Lawrence[2]
Propulsion:
single shaft
2 × water tube boilers
1 × double acting triple-expansion reciprocating steam engine
2,750 ihp (2,050 kW)
Range: 3,500 nautical miles (6,482 km) at 12 knots (22.2 km/h)
processing systems:
1 × SW1C or 2C radar
1 × Type 123A or Type 127DV sonar
Armament:
1 × BL 4-inch (101.6 mm) Mk.IX gun
2 × .50 cal machine gun (twin)
2 × Lewis .303 cal machine gun (twin)
2 × Mk.II depth charge throwers
2 × depth charge rails with 40 depth charges
